titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ships of Our Navy viewbook V1986.037
titlestmt.author: Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:20:09 +0000.

did.abstract: The Ships of Our Navy viewbook consists of 10 black-and-white non-photographic prints of photogravures of United States Navy battleships depicted on the East River and in New York Harbor in New York City.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reproduction rights for images from the viewbook have not been evaluated. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library. Please consult library staff for more information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1986.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: M. E. Sullivan was a New York City-based publisher whose office was located at 320 Broadway in Manhattan. Viewbooks, also called souvenir albums or view albums, are books that contain commercially published groups of photographs depicting a place, activity, or event.

list.head: Sources:
list.item: Getty Research Institute: Art & Architecture Thesaurus. "Viewbooks." Accessed June 27, 2011. http://www.getty.edu/vow/AATFullDisplay?find=viewbooks&logic=AND&note=&english=N&prev_page=1&subjectid=300026684

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Ships of Our Navy viewbook, V1986.037, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Ships of Our Navy viewbook consists of 10 black-and-white non-photographic prints of photogravures of United States Navy battleships depicted on the East River and in New York Harbor in New York City. The viewbook was published in 1903 by M. E. Sullivan. The original softcover of the viewbook was recovered with a hardcover library binding and page size measures 5.5 x 7. Digital versions of the images from the viewbook are available via the image database located in the library.
